subject: Technology
title: Mobile Payments: Your Phone as a Wallet
description: A short lesson to help you apply Mobile Payments: Your Phone as a Wallet.

hook.text: In Kenya, more people send money by phone than by bank. Mobile payments leapfrogged traditional banking entirely.

buildup.text: M-Pesa launched in 2007, letting Kenyans send money via text message. No bank account or smartphone needed.

discovery.text: Apple Pay, Google Pay, and WeChat Pay turned phones into contactless wallets. Tapping replaced swiping everywhere.

twist.text: China went nearly cashless through WeChat and Alipay. Street vendors, temples, even beggars accept phone payments.

climax.text: Mobile payments now move trillions of dollars yearly. The smartphone didn't just replace the phone â€” it replaced the wallet.

punchline.text: A phone call app became the world's biggest bank.

quiz.question: What was revolutionary about M-Pesa in Kenya?
options: It was the first smartphone app
It let people send money by text without a bank account
